problem_metadata.title: Sliding Window Maximum
problem_metadata.content:
You are given an array of integers nums, there is a sliding window of size k which is moving from the very left of the array to the very right. You can only see the k numbers in the window. Each time the sliding window moves right by one position.

Return the max sliding window.

 

Example 1:

Input: nums = [1,3,-1,-3,5,3,6,7], k = 3
Output: [3,3,5,5,6,7]
Explanation: 
Window position                Max
---------------               -----
[1  3  -1] -3  5  3  6  7       3
 1 [3  -1  -3] 5  3  6  7       3
 1  3 [-1  -3  5] 3  6  7       5
 1  3  -1 [-3  5  3] 6  7       5
 1  3  -1  -3 [5  3  6] 7       6
 1  3  -1  -3  5 [3  6  7]      7

Example 2:

Input: nums = [1], k = 1
Output: [1]

 

Constraints:

  • 1 <= nums.length <= 105
  • -104 <= nums[i] <= 104
  • 1 <= k <= nums.length
hints: How about using a data structure such as deque (double-ended queue)?
The queue size need not be the same as the windowâ€™s size.
Remove redundant elements and the queue should store only elements that need to be considered.

submissions.title: Sliding Window Maximum
Sliding Window Maximum
Sliding Window Maximum
submissions.code:
from typing import List 
class Solution:
    def maxSlidingWindow(self, nums: List[int], k: int) -> List[int]:
        AnswerList : list = []
        r = k
        l = 0
        maxelement = max(nums[l:r])
        AnswerList.append(maxelement)
        l += 1
        r += 1

        while r <= len(nums):
            maxelement = max(nums[l : r])
            AnswerList.append(maxelement)
            l += 1
            r += 1
        return AnswerList
